Adjectives_key2:
An adjective is a word that describes, identifies, modifies, or quantifies something (a noun or a
pronoun).
Adjectives_key3: Kisi bhi 'noun' ko jo word describe karta hai, use "adjective" kehte hain.
Adjectives_key5: The **black** cat is climbing the **tall** tree.
Adjectives_key6: In English, an adjective usually comes before the noun it pertains to
Adjectives_key7: Example: a **red** apple or a **beautiful** dress
Adjectives_key8: Exercise: Pick out the Adjectives in the following and say which noun/pronoun they are describing:
Adjectives_key9: Have you heard the happy news?
Adjectives_key11: He found a rare coin in his garden.
Adjectives_key12: This restaurant has some delicious dishes.
Adjectives_key13: She has to complete these important papers today.
Adjectives_key14: Adjectives of quality say something about the trait of the noun while adjectives of quantity give the amount or number of the noun.
Adjectives_key16: They have a big house. (Adj of quality)
Adjectives_key17: We saw a very exciting film last night. (Adj of quality)
Adjectives_key18: The student needs four books. (Adj of quantity)
Adjectives_key19: There is a little oil in the can. (Adj of quantity)
Adjectives_key21:
Identify the adjectives in the following and say whether they describe quality or
quantity:
Adjectives_key22: Few students are absent all the time.
Adjectives_key23: He needs several people in his team.
Adjectives_key24: This is a useful piece of information.
Adjectives_key25: I spent the night in a comfor`tab`le hotel.
